Articles.Content:
I like it. Totally stole the fuselage to make my F-14 just so you know.

Also, how\'d you figure out the SAS trick there? I had been trying to dual mount engines, but I couldn\'t figure out how to get them symmetrical.

Flying it right now.

'Good Job'

I\'m not much of a Hardcore Aviator but this looks spot on and is easy to fly.

I also like the way you set up the landing gear. It really allows for a sharper takeoff angle due to the wheels being raised. 8)
This is a pretty well balanced little plane. Very easy on the landing.

> 
> I like it. Totally stole the fuselage to make my F-14 just so you know.
> 
> Also, how\'d you figure out the SAS trick there? I had been trying to dual mount engines, but I couldn\'t figure out how to get them symmetrical.

Sorry, I didn\'t look around alot before making this. The SAS worked because I don\'t have a Intake on the end of the dual engines. Other than that, thanks for the great feedback! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yep, I just tried it on another plane. You just don\'t put a air intake on the end of the engine, the try putting a SAS on the end.

> ![d7pvY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/d7pvY.jpg)
I meant I stole your SAS thing and the fuselage, you were first.
Working on more additions to addon to make it more realistic looking. 8)
How did you lengthen the landing gear on the side wheels? I could use that for the Me 262 I\'m making. (Has this nasty habit of flipping over during takeoff)
